article.headline: Alabama St. 69, Ark.-Pine Bluff 51
article.story: PINE BLUFF, Ark. (AP) -- Arkansas-Pine Bluff shot a dismal 28 percent in the second half as Alabama State cruised to a 69-51 win Monday. The Golden Lions (10-12, 6-5 Southwestern Athletic Conference) scored just 19 points in the second half. Brandon Brooks scored 19 points and Andrew Hayles had 18 to lead Alabama State (13-8, 9-2). Roland Pitch added a dozen points for the Hornets. Hayles surpassed 1,000 career points in the second half. Larry Williams led Arkansas-Pine Bluff with 17 points; no other Golden Lion scored more than 5 points. The Hornets, who trailed 32-30 at the half, outrebounded Arkansas-Pine Bluff 46-29 in the win.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
